Submodules¶

binance.api module¶

class binance.api.API(key=None, secret=None, base_url=None, timeout=None, proxies=None, show_limit_usage=False, show_header=False)¶

Bases: object

API base class

Keyword Args:

base_url (str, optional): the API base url, useful to switch to testnet, etc. By default it’s https://api.binance.com timeout (int, optional): the time waiting for server response, number of seconds. https://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/user/advanced/#timeouts proxies (obj, optional): Dictionary mapping protocol to the URL of the proxy. e.g. {‘https’: ‘http://1.2.3.4:8080’} show_limit_usage (bool, optional): whether return limit usage(requests and/or orders). By default, it’s False show_header (bool, optional): whether return the whole response header. By default, it’s False

limit_request(http_method, url_path, payload=None)¶

limit request is for those endpoints require API key in the header

limited_encoded_sign_request(http_method, url_path, payload=None)¶

This is used for some endpoints has special symbol in the url. In some endpoints these symbols should not encoded - @ - [ - ]

so we have to append those parameters in the url

query(url_path, payload=None)¶
send_request(http_method, url_path, payload=None, special=False)¶
sign_request(http_method, url_path, payload=None, special=False)¶
